questions.text: Who was the owner of "Cheers" two owners before Sam?
questions.explanation:
Gus.

	A man came in asking for Gus. Coach asked who and the guy got angry with him, so Coach asked Norm about it. When the man found out Gus was no longer the owner he was very upset because he had a problem and Gus was always the guy to talk to when there was a problem.

questions.text: When Norm said, "She may not be flashy enough for Sammy", how did Carla reply?
questions.correct: "They had Sammy in mind when they built her."
options: "She is the woman of Sammy's dreams."
questions.explanation:
"They had Sammy in mind when they built her."

	Sam was known for his love of women. This was the first time we saw a woman that interested Sam and Diane was surprised that he would be attracted to someone like her.

questions.text: What was the woman's name that Sam went almost went on a date with?
questions.explanation:
Brandee.

	Sam asked her what her name was and she replied "Brandee, with two ees." Diane started to laugh again because she just couldn't imagine anyone being that dumb.

questions.text: When Sam questioned Diane about her laughing, what did she reply?
questions.explanation:
"I love to laugh."

	Diane was actually quoting the woman from earlier. Diane obviously did not approve of her but Sam said he didn't care what she thought.

questions.text: Carla had a message from the woman Sam was interested in. What was the message?
options: "She fell in love at first site."
questions.explanation:
"She's getting a little utsie."

	Angela Aames played the part of Brandee. She had various bit parts in different TV shows, never really making it big. More often than not she was cast as a sex symbol.

questions.text: What did Diane say are found in hot dogs?
questions.explanation:
rat parts.

	Sam told Diane he liked hot dogs so she asked him if he read that there are rat parts in hot dogs. Sam replied, "I like rat parts, it's my favorite part of the hot dog."

questions.text: Why couldn't Gus drop by to help the man that came to the bar?
questions.explanation:
He was dead.

	Coach ended up helping the man instead. He did so without realizing what the man was saying. The man's son was gay and that was the issue he was having, but Coach thought the problem was that the man was dating someone black. But then Coach finally realized that the son was gay and told him to kick the boy out and stop loving him. The man took his advice to mean, "If I can't accept him for who he is, I'll lose him."

questions.text: What was the name of Sam's ex-wife?
questions.explanation:
Debra.

	Debra was played by Donna McKechnie. In 1976, McKechnie won a Tony Award for her performance of Broadway's "A Chorus Line".

questions.text: Sam said his life wasn't fun anymore. Who did he blame for that?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	He said before he met Diane he dated women who weren't very smart but they were fun. But now all he could do was think about how dumb the women he dates are.

questions.text: Diane told Sam he wouldn't be able to date a really intelligent woman because they'd see past his bull a mile away. Did Diane see past it?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam went on this whole thing about how he had never seen the color of Diane's eyes since he once saw a beautiful sunset. When she was in a dazed state he said to her, "Wouldn't work, huh?" She was still so mesmerized by it that she didn't get what he was saying and then when he explained she said, "In a minute."
